content.content: It’s important for us to get to know a little about each other as we work together to effectively manage MakerDAO. Introduce yourself  Things to potentially include:  How you were introduced to Maker Where you’re geographically based out of Background info on your personal, intellectual, professional, and academic interests Why you might be passionate about Maker What you hope to contribute here What you hope to learn here etc…

woo hoo. Very cool.   Everyone is welcome!! Rather not introduce myself by name at this point.   Everyone can just call me MakerMan.    How I was introduced to Maker.    Tough one.   I trade a lot of Ethereum and frequent reddit /r/ethtrader so I probably ran into Maker there.   geographically US.   Background - Long time freelance IT consult team lead on heavy iron (all forms of Unix BSD/SYSV variants) sysadm/system analyst specializing in restoring IT operations and process optimization.   Education - physicist M.S. Solid State Theoretical Physics, Plasma Physics, Chemical Physics with a strong secondary background in EE (Both Analog and Digital with a focus on Digital), Human Machine Interface design and optimization, controls, both from a theoretical and practical standpoint.   Interests are far too numerous to list but run the full gamut from astrophysics, to nuclear and almost everything in between.   Strong personal interest in poker, game theory, social dynamics, etc.   Why I am here.   Because I think MakerDAO is probably the most interesting thing going on in the crypto space at this point as well as Ethereum and I have a desire to contribute in a positive way to this project.   Given I have worked in a lot of business environments both as an owner and consultant I have a pretty strong financial background and interest in the DeFi space.   Given my interests and fields of study are so diverse I consider myself to have a strong multidisciplinary background and can bring knowledge/studies from many fields to particular problems that most can’t.   Something you will learn from me because everyone who gets to know me knows they are my pet phrases when it comes to ‘proposals’.   I will often ask. What is the goal?  and By what method(s) will we measure the achievement (or failure) of that goal?   I find good answers to the above two questions to drive success or failure and realize quite often we have to try 1000 times and fail to succeed once.   A friend put it a better way.   To able to be the genius you have to be willing to be the fool. Usually with high powered individuals there is a lot of ego and emotion.   I continue to work to moderate this because negativity rarely creates a positive result practically as well as socially.

My name is David Utro, I’m public about my identity because I’ve long lost hope in maintaining my online privacy. I still maintain some mysteries, though tbh it’s whatever man. I’m based in NY. Some background: I graduated from Baruch College in 2016 with a BA in Corporate Communications. I had no idea what I wanted to do professionally while I was in college, so I went for a general degree that I found interesting and useful. I am fascinated by many topics and am a total skeptic about almost everything that falls into my lap. I self-study the things I am curious about and have not believed too strongly in school being the main source of someone’s education. Although it is a very amazing resource for the students who take advantage. I’ve always been fascinated by computer science, communications, finance, mathematics, organizations, ethics, and most recently financial risk management(the list can really go on and on.) I found out about MakerDAO in early 2017 after my buddy, Andrew, wouldn’t shut up about it. After months of his badgering, I finally read the whitepaper. I became fascinated by MakerDAO and the potential it has. So, for the next couple of years, I hung out in the chat and Reddit community before being hired by the Maker Foundation to work on Community Development alongside Rich Brown.

@MakerMan @Davidutro , Thanks for sharing this . I found this site while creating a bot and looking on the web about cryptocurrency. This lead me to here, a lot of clicks i must say and a lot of curiosity about what you are doing. Geographically Located in Quebec, Montreal, Canada. Trade all level, i can build a house from scratch by my own, mechanical knowledge and electrical to hydraulics. Computer i can say advance level overall, overclocking , Now starting to learn to code as much i can since it’s the race for Crypto and the world of internet will explose sooner or later. Administration and data for Machine Learning, Network Security and many more. My Interest are very global . Artificial Intelligence, i have a lot of interest into this direction and also robotics, everything around these area related from close or far. VR are a big  role i think in a futur that can be associated with AI and crypto if you have a open-mind, sports, 3D dev and mod, Video-Games… I think one of my favorite is theory and phylosophy. Antique and archeologie , symbols and language. I think what you are doing is part of a contribution in a better-world and a major change that will lead to multiple beneficial situations or idea. I introduce myself to you because you now represent a story to tell and if i can be part of it , I’m In !

Hi everyone My name is Adrien. Note that I’ve updated this in May 2021 for the DAO members curious to know more. I’m based in Barcelona (Spain) and Sinai (Egypt). Traveling often to France, Switzerland & Germany. I speak English, French, Spanish and conversational German. I used to be a software dev for 8 years and transitioned to non-programming positions when entering full-time into crypto. I currently (2021) usually work in Marketing position but my passion for crypto led me to build a lot of knowledge across many aspects of the space in which I consulted and/or contributed: tokenomics, fundraising, research, analysis, vetting-processes, community building, events, and more. I was introduced to Maker in 2017, probably while reading frantically (what a time to enter the blockchain space) tbh I don’t remember. Maker was already standing out as one of the strongest projects out there and DAI as the purest form of crypto-dollar. I’ve been a strong supporter of DAI since then. Here is a breakdown of my involvement in the crypto industry:   TLDR: I am a self-taught crypto-native working full time in the crypto industry since late 2017. I have deep knowledge across topics such as L1s, L2s, DeFi, DAOs, NFTs, Tokenomics Design, Marketing and Community Building.   In 2018, I was an analyst for a crypto VC which was very enlightening, I learnt the ins-and-outs of crypto investments, analyzed and vetted 100s of projects, connected and interviewed dozens of startup founders. I witnessed many private investors & businesses bleed during the 2018-19 crypto winter, the conclusion was inevitable: the crypto space needs better treasury risk management and stable coins are key to achieving that goal.   In 2019, I consulted for a blockchain-for-good project called ixo, building a full blown ecosystem on top of Cosmos in order to make all parties involved in the sustainability space interact more efficiently & in new ways (read: better, cheaper, faster, more transparent and enabling new use cases).   In 2019, I got very involved in three DAOs: GenesisDAO (DAOstack mini-grant DAO), PolkaDAO (polkadot’s mini grant DAO) and FestDAO (mini-grant DAO for meetups). Track record here, here and here. Note that they all ran on DaoStack and that I was a strong advocate for the use of DAI in these DAOs which earned me quite some trouble at the time.   In 2020, I collaborated on the Cosmos lead crosschain standard for NFTs and Metadata effort as part of a new engagement with ixo network (c.f. 2019 paragraph above). This involved investigation across all chains regarding their NFT standards, formats and adoption. Outcome on interNFT.org.   In 2020-21 I got involved with aleph.im, doing Marketing and Comms for this crosschain decentralized project. Creating foundational content such as Deck and Papers (light paper, technical paper, etc), strategizing and running social media accounts, supporting the BD team with DDs and much more.   2018-present: I organize and facilitate many events with the long term goal to build sound communities that stay active and united no matter the state of the market. I run 50+ events and still love doing this as I find this extremely rewarding. The outcomes have been amazing personally and for many of the community members involved. A highlight on that: I run an evening of participative DAO events during EthCC 2020 with 120+ attendees, partially sponsored by Maker, on a shoestring budget of $630.    Connect with me  twitter.com/AdrienBe_ linkedin.com/in/adrienbe

@AdrienDLT Hi My friend, Welcome to MakerDAO The Official Welcome Thread ! Have some time reading the guidelines and sneak around . You will find nice stuff here guaranteed !!!     Forum Index : https://forum.makerdao.com/t/648 Feedback : https://forum.makerdao.com/c/site-feedback
@AdrienDLT , How do you find your time on here Sir. I hope that you appreciate it. If there is something we can make better for you, please give your feedback ! Have a great weekend sir !

Hello everyone. I go by Silto on the internet, you can find my identity from this nickname pretty easily but honestly Silto is simpler. I can’t remember exactly how I was introduced to Maker, I’ve been following the crypto space for years, so it was pretty logical that at some point I’d discover it. I also participated in a crypto project at the start of the bear market and did the cryptoeconomics of the stablecoin we envisioned for our system. We didn’t raise enough to meet our soft cap, reimbursed investors and closed the business. Now that I think about it I might have stumbled upon Maker while researching stablecoins at that time. My interest about it has grown since then and I think it has great potential. I’m a small holder of MKR, I have some DAI in DSR, I have used Compound and voted a couple of times. I’m from France, in Lyon to be precise. This is the point where I apologize for my english, I understand it perfectly but my sentences construction can get weird. I’m a 28 years old electronics and IT engineer, I work as a freelance in web full stack dev,  and am creating a web business on the side. I am more of a generalist than a specialist, even though 4 years of web dev has made me pretty good in Node/React/GraphQL stuff. On the technological side I’m interested in security and cryptography, blockchain tech, and generally try to stay informed on tech (theoretical and innovation, not the startup ecosystem). Outside of tech my main interests are economics, mainly monetary policy and development economics, with a focus on heterodox economics (main reads: Michael Hudson, Dani Rodrik, Erik Reinert, Steve Keen, David Graeber, Richard Werner, Ha-Joon Chang, …). I keep an eye on geopolitics, but I’m not remotely close to being an expert on that. I trade a bit of BTC with low leverage/low expectations, I find the discipline and social aspects of it interesting. The thing that triggered my registering here is that I wanted to post this: Thoughts about governance security and logic I’ve posted a bit on the Maker Reddit, but I’d be happy to discuss here too.
Hi @silto, Nice introduction ! Thanks for sharing with us ! Welcome On Board Captain !

Hi, as it is not hard to guess, my name is Adam Skrodzki. I’m from Poland, but currently stay on Malta. I’m computer programmer with ~12 years commercial experience. I was introduced to Ethereum in late 2017 and was fascinated by the idea of worldwide public computer (that is how I understand Ethereum) and shortly after I’ve found out about MakerDAO and was quite intrigued by advancement of their develpment and community building, so I decided to learn more about it.
Hello @Adam_Skrodzki, Thanks for your presentation and Welcome On Board!

Hi, I’m stable!  I live in the San Francisco Bay Area and I learned about Maker through a friend who works at a crypto company here. At first I was skeptical that DAI would be able to hold the peg but as I kept checking to see if it had, I learned more and more about the project. Now I think it’s one of the most impressive inventions of the last decade and think this community is going to be the prototype for the most interesting teamwork of the next one. I’ve definitely learned a lot about Finance as I’ve followed MKR/DAI and other crypto projects, but my primary interest is in online communities and the future of companies. I think MakerDAO is the most interested DAO today but I’m also excited about all of the DAO work happening with Aragon. I’m looking forward to learning more with y’all!

Hi everyone, Pleased to find myself here and looking forward to learning more about this project and meeting community members. I am based in south-east Australia and havelegal background currently working in insurance disputes - far from the realm of decentralised finance. I find myself here on this forum as in the pursuit of what next to study I cannot shake this interest in crytocurrencies, stablecoins, blockchain, and the like. My interests all stem from fascination with understanding the development, function, and regulation of society. This extends to how legal, financial, political, and technological systems operate to manifest and progessively evolve the global community we find ourselves in. Otherwise I enjoy learning about the science of health, fitness, diet, and the like. I plan and track all of my exercise and nutrition in an attempt to optimise my health at the lowest cost possible. Many of my elder family members have early onset dementia and/or cancer, hence the desire to control what variables I can. Cheers!

Hellooo! <3 I’m Leo Saraceno! I forgot to introduce myself on this tread earlier. I messed up anonymity on the internet a looong time ago like many others of my age, so you can call me Leo, Mitote or whatever you want really (btw Mitote comes from The Four Agreements by Don Miguel Ruiz). Like @Davidutro someone named Andrew introduced me to ethereum in September 2017 and I found Maker that November on reddit. I started really trying to learn the protocol around the start of SCD. I definitely did alot more lurking than participating, it took awhile to feel confident enough in the system dynamics. I’m here because its more compelling than what I see elsewhere. My development lead me to hate (I’m learning the power of love) aspects of civilization and society. I guess that I am at least a little younger than all of you, so I don’t have a ton of relevant professional experience and kinda just wing these intellectual/academicy things cause I’m curious. My main interests and goals evolve around ecology, biology, biochemistry (increasingly the electric potentials in biology, so bio-physical-chemistry?idk), but everything is really f*cking interesting and I am so very novice in all of it. I also read about economics, history/sociology, physics, behavioral stuff, cosmology. I have a love hate relationship with science/logic, so I got some other stuff going on to get out of that mode. Oh I live in the US, briefly went to university, but thought it was silly. I got paid for work on the collateral application process, but that’s the extent of my involvement with the foundation.
Welcome @Mitote       It was about time !

Hi @Joshua_Pritikin, Here this is  The Official Welcome Thread You might have more chance for a reply in the appropriate section Uncategorized Or Site Feedback Otherwise, you can go in your Preferences, Notifications and TAGS, look up there so you can ban or put the emphase on some words. I hope it did help you. Good evening!

Hi, my name is Dawson. I’m a software developer and traveler. I’ve been traveling continuously for 3-4 years, but I’m settling down now and plan to stay in one place for a couple years. I’ll keep my location private for now because these things make me paranoid, but I’m looking forward to the extra time this will afford me to get involved in Maker. I found out about Maker two 2 years ago in Tokyo where I met a member of the team (but don’t recall the name). I didn’t understand it at the time but I grasp it much better now. I appreciate Maker as a tool for taking decentralized leverage. I think this will (and is) being used to build interesting financial products that will lead to not only a stable Dai, but a (relatively) stable Eth. As a software developer I write a lot of Typescript (aka strongly typed Javascript), Python and Golang. I also have a strong interest in web security and a hobby interest in economics. Cheers!
Hi @dawson and welcome to the community. As a software developer you are possibly aware of this page https://makerdao.com/en/careers.

I haven’t taken a look at the careers page but I will. I guess I assumed that working for Maker is contrary to decentralizing Maker, but really it seems like the best way to dedicate my time to contributing. Thanks!

You absolutely don’t need to officially work for the Foundation in order to contribute, although I’m sure you’d be welcome  There is money available through community grants programs (which are operated by the Foundation but are ‘one step removed’ so to speak.)

Hello Everyone, My name is Adrian.  I live in Portland, Oregon.  I’m a technology professional from the semiconductor industry, but starting a six month software engineering bootcamp in a few weeks.  Moving from hardware to software. I discovered cryptocurrency (bitcoin) in 2016, and was instantly fascinated.  I would love to work in blockchain development.  I do technical writing on the side a little bit (realtechwriter.com).  At the beginning of January, someone paid me for my work in Dai, and I had never heard of it.  I started nosing around online and stumbled into the forum and chat area where I found the Help wanted for a Governance summary.  I am pleased to be learning about the platform and Governance.  I take weekly snapshots of the issues and produce a summary that can be found at mkrdai.info  . The community here is very welcoming, and I appreciate that.  I think the MakerDAO culture and currencies have what it takes to bring cryptocurrency into the hands of the everyday person.  I would love to live in a world where it’s as easy to spend a DAI as it is a DOLLAR.

adrianhacker-pdx:  I take weekly snapshots of the issues and produce a summary that can be found at mkrdai.info .   I didn’t even know this existed until today! Another resource I can point newbies to. Great job!

Hey all! I’m a techie finance guy based in London working on Ethereum related software. I’ve been keen on all things DeFi, including Maker and DAI, for a little while now. After lurking here for a bit thought it would be good to dip my toe in a bit more
Welcome aboard! Always good to get more people contributing in meaningful ways. Consider joining us on the official chat too, there are often interesting discussions going on.

Hello Everyone I am Blake and I am located in west Texas. In 2013 I was introduced to Bitcoin. The whitepaper inspired a great love for distributed systems. In 2019 I became more able to learn and invest in the cryptocurrency world. Dai was my first introduction to a stable coin that embodied the distributed nature of the ecosystem. Hello, all, Introduced to Maker through my interest in Ethereum’s PoW to POS migration. Found Maker to be a super positive force with massive upside potential. I made my way to this forum because I wanted to be involved. I have no code skills, but I do have a large interest in finance. Decentralized Finance is an area I am always trying to learn more about. I am based out of the east coast USA. I am a project manger during the day, which helps pay some of my bills and feed my family.  However I am always learning more about blockchain, finance, and language. I want to contribute however I can to this effort, so please feel free to contact me and keep me in mind.  As I mentioned I am not a developer or posses much technical know how. Given the fact DeFi is relatively new, and most work being done is technical, I hope to find ways to contribute. See you around!

Welcome to the forum! There are governance and risk meetings every week on Thursday at 9am  PST which are a good introduction if you are new to Maker. There are definitely ways to contribute that are not technical. There is a fair amount of governance work to be done, along with documentation, organisation, etc. Feel free to hit me up on rocket chat if you want to chat about things

Hello Friends! I snuck my way into the forums after being a long time lurker and realized I’ve never introduced myself. My name is Jon, (I also just realized I missed a great opportunity to create a cool crypto alias… lets go with GetRichOrDaiTryin’ or NoTimeToDai ).  I’ve known about Maker since the ICO boom, but didn’t start following closely until MCD was launched.  My background is in classical sciences, not these newfangled computer sciences (though I’m trying to learn enough to keep up).  I felt pulled into this group by all the incredibly talented individuals and fascinating subjects, and I just wanted to be a part of that.  I feel if we can get this community to work - an inclusive place of new ideas and positive debate, and do it in a Twitch Plays Federal Reserve fashion (thanks @NikKunkel) this DAO could really be something special.  It feels like the future. See you in the forums!

Hi Guys! Same as most never so this post so I will give a quick intro😂. My name is Mario, located in Uruguay and lived a while in Poland when I was a child. Love to travel (south east asia ). From an academic background I’m a public accountant with an MBA from ieem and a master in blockchain from universidad de salamanca (not recomended), currently doing the cfa although I’m currently quite lazy to study. Basically most of my profesional life is around organizational skills, group management, internal controls, accounting & finance. I got introduced to maker through ethereum, while doing the mba with a couple of friends in 2017 we started mining ethereum (small totally losing operation ) and then i started getting interested in blockchain technology, in particular ethereum. After that during 2018 started heavily analyzing projects, specially maker dao and how it kept the peg during the crypto dump and so I decided to become a mkr hodler. I have been reading the forums for a while and just since mainly the covid lockdown started to participate . Happy to meet such a great community
We have a lot of new people showing up. Please introduce yourselves. Bumping this thread for visibility.

ChrisGryphen here; Im an American. I have a degree in cultural studies. I hope to be “Financially Independent & Retire Early” (F.I.R.E.) Public radio introduced me to blockchains when $BTC reached $1,000. I was in college; I had those typical expenses (food & rent) so I did not invest in that first opportunity. You are all here before me, or have come since me because you recognize de-fi is a great opportunity. I (luckily) opted-in just before the “2020 Summer De-Fi Boom.” I began with the usual app. Then followed the trend–look for cheaper places to buy coins; then yield farm. Labor Day 2020 was a quick first lesson in loss. I very quickly learned why stable coins are helpful. I kayak, camp, climb. But on a budget–nothing extreme.
Hi @ChrisGryphen and welcome to the community! Cultural studies? I think you have come to the right place as I think this forum is pretty diverse. Maybe not what you do in your day job, but still.

@Planet_X Yes, I am going through everyone’s intros; its exciting to witness the De-Fi in progress. We are the generation that will make the long-term decisions. We will directly guide the next “transfer of wealth.” Its no longer shovels and sifters; its RAM and 5G. We all (probably) have “Limit Orders” set on various platforms. (If not, you should.) Some of us bake Tezzos, some do Compound. Im sure plenty cross over to here (and there and plenty in-between). Reading Hamilton and Jefferson’s ideas about banking always fascinated me. I am excited to be involved with the next conversation. @MakerMan [quote=“MakerMan, post:3, topic:771”] game theory [/quote I also love games and puzzles. I grew up with Avalon Hill, Parker Bros, Milton Bradely. I look for “Mensa Select” games and others by those winning companies. “Corporative” games seem to be trendy–I see a lot of them in my local shop. Pandemic, ironically, is fun. Covid disbanded my D&D party. I had time to fill; that also lead to my re-interest in block chains. My party, we just started “Curse of Strahd 5e” so that was a bummer.
Hey everyone, Can here from Secret Network (formerly Enigma). Long time maker fan and CDP holder  I recently posted about bringing privacy to MKR and DAI. Interested to hear the community’s thoughts!

Hello World! Prose here, you might have seen some of my posts since I came to the forum about a week and a half ago. I’m from/living in the US (currently hiding out from the Connecticut winter in sunny Florida). I have a BA in Political Science, with minors in Spanish and Creative Writing. Oddly enough Coinbase Earn turned me on to MakerDAO. Usually I just sit through the videos to get some free crypto and add to my research list, but when they started to explain MakerDAO my jaw dropped. To me this is enabling a system for the little guy. No longer are only the wealthiest individuals able to collateralize their assets for spending power, anyone who is long crypto and understands a few basic tenants of risk management can do everything from provide purchasing power at low interest rates to take advantage of yield spreads across the market. I’ve been researching Maker and the DeFi space every sense fate brought me one of the coolest, world changing ideas on a silver plate. Thanks for the warm welcome to the community, happy to count my self as a Maker Holder and Vault Owner

Hi everyone, my name is Felix. I lived in Canada, french Canadian to be exact. I’ve learned about MakerDAO throughout 1Hive, which is an odd turn of events. I’m a software developer, full-stack to be exact. If I have some time I may even help with some pull request. I’ll try to give out my opinion and challenging decision making in this DAO! I’m happy to join this community, I always wanted to help a blockchain project but didn’t get the chance to!

Hello everyone, this is Emilio. I just got hired at the Foundation as a Smart Contracts Engineer.  I’ve been interested in Maker since I read about stablecoins in an article by Vitalik in early 2017. I think at the time SAI hadn’t launched yet. I bought 1 MKR around that time. I still hold it, but I’m not sure I’ve ever voted on anything. I live in Bogotá, Colombia, where I was born. My grandparents emigrated from Europe before WWII, so I have the German nationality as well. I plan to live in Berlin someday. I’m a Computer Engineer from Colombia’s best private university, and a Linguist from Colombia’s best public university. I graduated at the same time from both universities. I like rock climbing, tree climbing, tennis, yoga and African dance. I’m a vegetarian. I’m very interested in space exploration. I like talking about politics and philosophy. I speak Spanish, English, French and German.  Today was my first governance call and I didn’t understand much. But I love new challenges. See you around! Emilio

Welcome @e18r! Looking forward to seeing your contributions and working together for a stronger DAO  if you want to put that MKR to use consider going over to vote.makerdao.com and vote to secure the new chief!

Introduction of Secure Digital Markets (SDM) What is Secure Digital Markets (SDM)? Secure Digital Markets (SDM) is a premier digital asset brokerage that offers institutional and HNWI clients spot cryptocurrency OTC trading and access to institutional grade lending services. Using best in market technology, we offer our clients the most secure on and off ramp facilities, trading services, and portfolio management services available in the market today. SDM was one of the first electronic, off-exchange digital asset liquidity providers in North America that operates through a robust electronic communication network (ECN). We provide curated liquidity solutions ranging from auto-liquidation to a direct feed of liquidity straight to your API. Our service is simple: we source an unmatched depth of liquidity for you through our proprietary network of exchanges and market makers. You will have the freedom to facilitate and navigate SDM’s services in multiple ways, to meet whatever needs you may have. These platforms include direct messaging channels for sales and trades of cryptocurrencies, API integration (fixed, rest and web-socket) as well as a web-based interface available upon request. This allows you to tailor your experience to whatever is most convenient for you and your business model. You will have a dedicated account manager paired with 24/7 support. We service:  Cryptocurrency miners Exchanges Payment processors Investment funds HNWI Family offices DAOs  What is SDM Lending? SDM Lending offers access to non-recourse lending against select cryptocurrencies. We carefully select our lending counterparties through an extensive analysis of counterparty risk. Our most prolific lenders are unleveraged family offices. Key features of our lending offering include:  Crypto-backed financing: Access to capital employing crypto assets as collateral Borrower retains all market appreciation: The borrower retains all upside in the asset at loan maturity Low fixed rates: A fixed-term facility with competitive fixed interest rates Higher value for borrower assets: Typical loan-to-value-ratio greater than 65% Non-recourse loans: The borrower’s risk is limited to the assets used as collateral in the transaction Fast and efficient: Complete the process from start to finish in a matter of days Margin call structure: Terms allow for more volatility in the asset price and a five-business day decision period  SDM Lending is headed by James Godfrey, who leveraged his 35 years of international Capital Markets experience to build out one of the safest lending desks in the industry. Why Secure Digital Markets? Best-In-Class Liquidity With ultra-low latency connectivity streams to 25+ of the industry’s largest liquidity providers, SDM provides the tightest spreads on all cryptocurrency exposure with limited drawdown. Regulator And Compliance Focused SDM Inc. is a money service business registered with the Financial Transactions and Reports Analysis Centre of Canada (FINTRAC), and has adopted industry-leading AML practices and procedures. Flexible Service & Same Day Settlement SDM offers around the clock service and guarantees same day settlement on all transactions. Credit facilities and flexible recoupment schedules are available. API Connectivity Two sided, continuous 24-hour price stream via FIX, REST, or WebSocket API connectivity fills both sides of the orderbook and ensures automated execution is completed with tight spreads. Superior Customer Support A dedicated account manager will be assigned to you, allowing direct access to traders and customer support will be available via various communication channels around the clock. What opportunities exist for SDM and Maker DAO? SDM can provide Maker DAO with a custom pathway to cryptocurrency OTC spot trading through GUI, voice or API. Tailored liquidity pairings include the top 40 digital assets, and SDM can extend its offering to include MKR as a pair that can be traded. We are currently integrated with more than 25 liquidity providers and over 5 crypto native banks, and can enable integration with wallet service providers should that be of value to you. Why is SDM an optimal partner for Maker DAO? The answer to this question covers several service areas. For one, Secure Digital Markets hangs its hat on our customer service. From our earliest days, we’ve been committed to supporting our clients and partners with dedicated account managers providing peerless, "always on” availability. Further, we understand that as decentralized autonomous organizations grow in popularity, so too has your need for access to instant capital. Our ability to provide pooled liquidity ensures that our traders are empowered to withdraw assets from one side of the pool (buying) and add assets to the other side (selling) in a single move. Working with SDM, you will benefit from our OTC service offerings that provide many key benefits including funds that are traded via a dealer network rather than a centralized exchange, often meaning much faster settlement periods. Rather than trying to simultaneously balance trades from all over the world, SDM handles transactions as they come in, allowing our traders to continually provide the highest levels of service and communication with our clients. Trading with SDM is facilitated through secure chats to trade via RFQ, voice, or through a direct web GUI or fixed API connectivity, and we are proud that our clients benefit from our aggressive pricing strategy, allowing them to maximize the value of their trades. Our goal in the digital asset space is to set the bar as the best on and off-ramp service provider in North America, providing all services related to the digital asset space for our clients.

Hello Folks! My name is Shawn. Though I have been aware of MakerDAO for some time, we became more acquainted with you via the HVB press announcements. I work as the head of BaaS and Tech Strategy for Lineage Bank in Franklin TN (20 minutes south of Nashville). We just had a call this morning with couple of your collateral managers to learn more about how Lineage could foster a relationship with the community. Though I have been in the crypto space since 2016, my business partner and I decided to move away from mining and genesis projects with Amoveo, Raven and a couple others to focus on opportunities for broader adoption and meaningful use cases. We realized that this effort would need the involvement of traditional finance. In 2019 we partnered up with other investors and tenured local bankers who have taken a denovo bank in 2007 to 4 billion in assets and an IPO on NYSE. (Formerly Franklin Synergy Bank) to seed a raise to acquire a bank in west Tennessee. We finalized the acquisition in Jan 2020 of the single bank holding company and relocated the bank charter to Nashville area. This was the smallest chartered FDIC regulated bank by assets in TN state at 27 MM. 18 months later we are 200 MM. Middle TN has enjoyed explosive growth these last 10 years. Our commercial lending market (Williamson County) further enjoys one of the lowest commercial loan default ratios in the US. The bank is bursting at the seams with growth, but that growth is slowed by the demands of capital ratios regulated institutions are required to maintain. Our BaaS business has grown to 80 MM in deposits and our commercial loan portfolio is just north of 100 MM with over 200 MM in originated CRE loans which have been participated because our capital ratios will not allow us to keep that on our balance sheet. We would love to learn more about the community’s appetite for not only the type of assets you are investing in with HVB, but also if the community would be interested in a senior debt offering to the bank’s holding company (which owns 100% of Lineage Bank.) A senior debt offering would/could include other participants, such as banks and garner a 7%+ yield to go along with high quality commercial paper yields generated from our local market. We are happy to network and get as acquainted with the community as the community desires. We are connected to several crypto communities in discord. I am personally acquainted with founders of projects in the NFT space, Synapse (SYN) and successful DA funds. We are excited to see MakerDAO working with traditional finance to grow asset diversity amongst it’s community and impressed with the approach. We hope to learn as much as we can and see how Lineage can meaningfully work with you all. Thanks for your time. Shawn

Hi guys. My name is Fiaz. I am posting here at Shawn and PaperImperium’s (MakerDAO/Discord) suggestion I am based in Florida. Interests include physics, philosophy, computer science, payments, fintech, and programmable money. Familiar with Maker for a while, but I have been thinking about DeFI and how it could have a transformative effect on the non crypto native world for some time . I have worked in fintech my whole adult career, many years as a developer, then as a business line/industry guy focused on banking and payments. So why am I here, what do I hope to contribute and what do I hope to learn ? Today  I work in a large fintech company that works with a lot of banks - in my particular case, I work with smaller US institutions that are looking for more ways to compete with the megabanks and digital only players, while trying to serve their communities at the same time - mainstreet america. Liquidity is king and its getting tougher given the macro and micro environments – challenging to say the least. I am engineer by trade, but nowadays I am a business line leader who is thinking about creative ways to help an industry better serve its communities and end customers while helping it compete better against the megabank + nonbank players. What MakerDao has done with HVB is a very interesting template for how DeFI and community banking can work together – community banks get access to liquidity – global liquidity – without impacting the balance sheet. The DAO gets real world yield in exchange. This is, I hope, the beginning of a broader partnership between a great American industry – community banking -  and a great DeFi platform like Maker. So what do I hope to contribute? A proposition……I propose the Dao think about diversifying RW yield sources as Shawn noted. Ok so this doesn’t sound very interesting probably because other banks are talking to the Dao. I am saying let us work together to try to achieve “escape velocity” with this RW yield model – viz., rapid scaling into mainstream finance. Work with me, my interested clients, and my team to help ideate a way to rapidly scale the number of participating banks working with the Dao. One of my product colleagues is talking to the “business development” group in MakerDao, but I came in through Discord – they told me to find the core units  What do I hope to learn here? Are you guys interested? If so, let’s connect the dots and try to do something cool and potentially industry changing, that touches CeFI, DeFi and TradFI.
